variables.options: 'name, isEnabled, onEnable, onDisable, w, h, lblW'
variables.wiki:
Checkbox

Provides the ability to toggle a feature on or off, aswell as multi choice options.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_checkbox', HudCheckboxOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_button', {
 name: 'Enable Audio',
 isEnabled: ()=>{
  game._SETTINGS['audio'];
 },
 onEnable: ()=>{
  game._SETTINGS['audio'] = true;
 },
 onDisable: ()=>{
  game._SETTINGS['audio'] = false;
 }
});​

HudCheckboxOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
name string "Disabled" | "Enabled" Text to show on the button
isEnabled function undefined Function to check if it is enabled
onEnable function undefined Function to run when enabled
onDisable function undefined Function to run when disabled
w number 150 Width of the button
h number 40 Height of the button
lblW number 150 Width of the label

variables.options: 'name, onClick, pass, w, h, lblW'
'name, value, x, y, w, h, lblW'
'x, y, w, h, title, showX, titleW, titleH, name, callerObject, onClose, moveable'
variables.wiki:
Item Icon

Provides an icon for various game objects, sprites and inventory items.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_item_icon', ComponentItemIconOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_item_icon', {icon: 'test_xbow'});​

ComponentItemIconOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
icon string "test_xbow" Codename for: Sprites, Inventory Items, Complex Items
w number 64 Function to check if it is enabled
h number 64 Function to run when enabled
moveable boolean false Function to run when disabled

Text

Display text on the page, must use pre-defined styles.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_text', ComponentTextOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_text', {text: 'Hello world!', style: 'info-tagline'});​

ComponentTextOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
text string "Hello world!" The text to display
style string "info-tagline" The style name to show the text in

variables.options: 'name, onClick, pass, x, y, w, h, lblW'
variables.wiki:
Button

A descrpton Too asd

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_button', {HudButtonOptions});

E.g.

game.render.component('hud_button', {
 name: ,
 onClick: ()=>{
  console.log("Button Clicked");
 }
});

HudButtonOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
name strong NONAME The value to show on the button
onClick function undefined The function to run on click
w number 150 The width of the button
h number 40 The height of the button

variables.options: 'x, y, w, h, title, showX, titleW, titleH, name, callerObject, onClose, moveable'
'ref, value, max, min, w'
variables.wiki:
Counter

Provides a numerical counter with adjustable increments and a maximum and minimum value. Includes buttons to increase and decrease the count.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_counter', CounterOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_counter', {
  ref: {exampleCount: 0},
  value: 'exampleCount',
  min: 0,
  max: 10,
  multi: 2,
  w: 200
});​

CounterOptions Reference:

Property Data type Description Default value
ref object The object that contains the count value. undefined
value string The key of the count value in the ref object. undefined
min number The minimum value the count can be. 0
max number The maximum value the count can be. 10
multi number The amount by which the count changes with each button press. 1
w number The width of the counter element. 100

Dropdown

Provides a dropdown menu with selectable options.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_dropdown', HudDropdownOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_dropdown', {
    x: 100,
    y: 200,
    w: 200,
    h: 40,
    items: ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3'],
    selected: 'Option 1'
});​

HudDropdownOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
x number 0 X position of the dropdown
y number 0 Y position of the dropdown
w number 150 Width of the dropdown
h number 40 Height of the dropdown
items array ['val2', 'val1'] Array of selectable options
selected string 'val2' Default selected option

variables.options: 'x, y, w, h, title, showX, titleW, titleH, name, callerObject, onClose, moveable'
variables.wiki:
Tab Container

A container that displays multiple tabs, each containing a different component.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_container_tabs', TabContainerOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_container_tabs', {
    tabNames: ['Tab 1', 'Tab 2', 'Tab 3'],
    tabComponents: [
        game.render.component('hud_button', {name: 'Button 1'}),
        game.render.component('hud_button', {name: 'Button 2'}),
        game.render.component('hud_button', {name: 'Button 3'})
    ],
    w: 500,
    h: 300
});​

TabContainerOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
tabNames array ['tab1', 'tab2', 'tab3', 'new', 'brt', 'cod', 'hug', 'uhd'] Array of tab names
tabComponents array [game.render.component('hud_button', {name: 'hud1'}), game.render.component('hud_button', {name: 'hud2'}), game.render.component('hud_button', {name: 'hud3'})] Array of components to display in each tab
w number 500 Width of the tab container
h number 300 Height of the tab container

List Selector

Provides a UI component for selecting items from two lists and moving them between the lists.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_list_selector', ListSelectorOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_list_selector', {
    w: 300,
    h: 200,
    leftList: ['left', 'two', 'three'],
    rightList: ['another1']
});​

ListSelectorOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 300 Width of the list selector
h number 200 Height of the list selector
leftList array ['left', 'two', 'three'] Items to display in the left list
rightList array ['another1'] Items to display in the right list

Slider

Provides a draggable slider component that allows users to select a value within a specified range.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_slider', HudSliderOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_slider', {
    name: 'Volume',
    w: 300,
    h: 10,
    min: 0,
    max: 100,
    value: 50
});​

HudSliderOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 300 Width of the slider
h number 10 Height of the slider
min number 1 Minimum value of the slider
max number 100 Maximum value of the slider
value number 0 Initial value of the slider

Inventory Grid

Displays an inventory grid which accepts items of a given size xBlocks x yBlocks.

Syntax

game.render.component('inventoryGrid', InventoryGridOptions);​

Example

const inventoryGrid = game.render.component('inventoryGrid', {
    xBlocks: 4,
    yBlocks: 4,
    inventory: playerInventory
});​
inventoryGrid.x = 10;
inventoryGrid.y = 10;
pane.addChild(inventoryGrid);

InventoryGridOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
xBlocks number 1 Number of blocks in the x-axis
yBlocks number 1 Number of blocks in the y-axis
inventory object undefined The inventory object to display

Notes for ChatGPT or Open AI Assistants:

If the user asks for an inventory or inventory with x slots, you can assume they want to use this component. xBlocks and yBlocks are the equivalent of 2x2 being xBlocks = 2, yBlocks = 2

variables.wiki:
Money Label

Displays a label showing the amount of money.

Syntax

game.render.component('moneyLabel', MoneyLabelOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('moneyLabel', {
    name: 'Money',
    value: 100,
    x: 10,
    y: 10,
    w: 150,
    h: 30,
    lblW: 140
});​

MoneyLabelOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
name string "NONAME" Name of the money label
value number 0 Value of the money
x number 0 X position of the money label
y number 0 Y position of the money label
w number 100 Width of the money label
h number 30 Height of the money label
lblW number 90 Width of the label pane

variables.options: 'text, onChange'
variables.wiki:
Text Input

Provides the ability for the user to input text through the keyboard.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_text_input', TextInputOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_text_input', {
  text: 'example text',
  w: 200,
  onChange: function(text) {
    console.log(text);
  }
});​

TextInputOptions Reference:

Property Data Type Default Value Description
text string "I'm here" The default value for the input area
w number 300 Width of the input area
onChange function undefined Specifies a function to run when the value of the input changes

Slim Container

Creates a slim pane with optional title and close button.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_container_slim', SlimContainerOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('drawSlimPane', {
    x: 100,
    y: 100,
    w: 200,
    h: 100,
    title: 'Settings',
    showX: true,
    titleW: 180,
    titleH: 60,
    name: 'settingsPane'
});​

SlimContainerOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
x number 0 X position of the pane
y number 0 Y position of the pane
w number 64 Width of the pane
h number 64 Height of the pane
title string | false false Title text to display on the pane
showX boolean false Whether to show the close button
titleW number 180 Width of the title pane
titleH number 60 Height of the title pane
name string "NONAMEADDED" Name of the pane for identification

variables.wiki:
Radio Button

Provides the ability to select a single option from a group of options.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_radiod_button', HudRadiodButtonOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_radiod_button', {
    name: 'Option 1',
    isChecked: true,
    onClick: () => {
        console.log('Option 1 selected');
    }
});​

HudRadiodButtonOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
name string "NONAME" Text to show next to the radio button
w number 150 Width of the radio button
h number 40 Height of the radio button
pass boolean false Whether to pass an object
fill string "0x3d3d3d" Color fill of the radio button
isChecked boolean false Whether the radio button is initially checked
onClick function undefined Function to run when the radio button is clicked

A or B Input

Provides a user interface component for selecting between two options.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_aorb_input', HudAorBInputOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_aorb_input', {
    w: 200,
    h: 50,
    option1: 'Option A',
    option2: 'Option B',
    defaultValue: 0,
    onChange: (selectedOption) => {
        console.log('Selected option:', selectedOption);
    }
});​

HudAorBInputOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 150 Width of the component
h number 40 Height of the component
option1 string "op1" Text to display for option 1
option2 string "op2" Text to display for option 2
defaultValue number 0 Default selected option (0 for option 1, 1 for option 2)
onChange function null Function to be called when the selected option changes

variables.options: 'item'
variables.wiki:
Stat Table

Displays a table of stats for an item, such as armor or weapon.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_stat_table', StatTableOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_stat_table', {
    stats: {
        'maxSpeed': 10,
        'maxHP': 100,
        'maxWeight': 50
    },
    oWidth: 500,
    showResourceIcons: true
});​

StatTableOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
stats object {} Object containing the stats to display in the table
oWidth number 450 Width of the table
showResourceIcons boolean true Whether to show resource icons for each stat

variables.wiki:
Scrolling Text

Provides a scrolling text effect where the text is revealed letter by letter.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_scrolling_text', ScrollingTextOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_scrolling_text', {
    text: "I am talking...",
    w: 300,
    h: 50,
    delay: 100
});​

ScrollingTextOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
text string "I am talkin..." The text to be displayed
w number 300 Width of the scrolling text container
h number 50 Height of the scrolling text container
delay number 100 Delay in milliseconds for each letter to be revealed

variables.options: 'name, value, x, y, w, h, lblW'
variables.wiki:
Text Carousel

Displays a carousel of text items with navigation buttons to scroll through the items.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_text_carousel', TextCarouselOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_text_carousel', {
    w: 500,
    h: 500,
    items: ['Title 1', 'Title 2', 'Title 3'],
    bottomTexts: ['Here is some example text', 'Example 2', 'Example 3']
});​

TextCarouselOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 500 Width of the carousel
h number 500 Height of the carousel
items array ['Title 1', 'Title 2', 'Title 3'] Array of text items to display in the carousel
bottomTexts array ['Here is some example text', 'Example 2', 'Example 3'] Array of text to display below each item in the carousel
topFill string '0x212121' Color fill for the top pane
buttonFill string '0x3d3d3d' Color fill for the navigation buttons
bottomFill string '0x2A2A2A' Color fill for the bottom pane
textFill string '0x3d3d3d' Color fill for the text in the bottom pane

variables.options: 'w, h, onClick, title'
variables.wiki:
Request Text

Provides a dialog box for the user to enter text and save it.

Syntax

game.render.component('request_text', RequestTextOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('request_text', {
    w: 500,
    h: 300,
    onClick: (val) => {
        console.log("Saved with", val);
    },
    title: 'Enter Name',
    btnText: 'Save',
    text: 'New Save',
    hideX: false
});​

RequestTextOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 400 Width of the dialog box
h number 230 Height of the dialog box
onClick function function(val){console.log("Saved with", val)} Callback function to execute when the save button is clicked. Receives the entered text as a parameter.
title string "Save name" Title text to display in the dialog box
btnText string "Save" Text to display on the save button
text string "New Save" Default text to display in the input field
hideX boolean false Whether to hide the close button (X) in the dialog box

Bars Counter

Displays a set of bars to represent a value, with customizable options.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_bars_counter', HudBarsCounterOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_bars_counter', {
    value: 7,
    orientation: 'vertical',
    barWidth: 15,
    barHeight: 30,
    barCount: 8,
    barSpacing: 3,
    barTint: 0x00FF00,
    warning: true
});​

HudBarsCounterOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
value number 5 The current value to display
orientation string "horizontal" The orientation of the bars ("horizontal" or "vertical")
barWidth number 10 The width of each bar
barHeight number 25 The height of each bar
barCount number 10 The total number of bars to display
barSpacing number 5 The spacing between each bar
barTint number 0x40FF77 The color of the bars
warning boolean false Whether to enable warning colors for low values

Circle Counter

Displays a circular counter with a fill percentage.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_circle_counter', HudCircleCounterOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_circle_counter', {
    w: 200,
    thickness: 10,
    ringColor: "0x3d3d3d",
    fillColor: "0xff0000",
    value: 75
});​

HudCircleCounterOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 150 Width of the circle counter
thickness number 9 Thickness of the circle border
ringColor string "0x3d3d3d" Color of the circle border
fillColor string "0xff0000" Color of the filled portion of the circle
value number 50 Value representing the fill percentage of the circle

Button

Provides a clickable button component with customizable options.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_button', HudButtonOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_button', {
    name: 'Click Me',
    w: 200,
    h: 50,
    fill: '0xff0000',
    onClick: () => {
        console.log('Button clicked');
    }
});​

HudButtonOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
name string "NONAME" Text to display on the button
w number 150 Width of the button
h number 40 Height of the button
pass boolean false Whether to pass an object
fill string "0x3d3d3d" Color fill of the button to match the theme
onClick function undefined Function to run when the button is clicked

Creates a container with multiple pages for easy navigation.

Syntax

game.render.component('easypages', EasyPagesOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('easypages', {
    pages: 5,
    w: 500,
    h: 500
});​

EasyPagesOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
pages number 5 Number of pages to create
w number 500 Width of the container

Health bar

Displays a health bar with a customizable value, bar color, and text color.

Syntax

game.render.component('hud_health_bar', HudHealthBarOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('hud_health_bar', {
    w: 200,
    h: 30,
    value: 75,
    barColor: "0xFF0000",
    textColor: "0xFFFFFF"
});​

HudHealthBarOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 200 Width of the health bar
h number 30 Height of the health bar
value number 100 Current value of the health bar
barColor string "0xFF0000" Color of the health bar
textColor string "0xFF0000" Color of the text displaying the value

Scrollbox

Provides a scrollable container for displaying content.

Syntax

game.render.component('component_scrollbox', ScrollboxOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('component_scrollbox', {
    w: 500,
    h: 500
});​

ScrollboxOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 500 Width of the scrollbox
h number 500 Height of the scrollbox

Stat Bar

Displays a bar representing a stat value, such as health points (HP).

Syntax

game.render.component('statBar', StatBarOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('statBar', {
    name: 'HP',
    value: 75,
    maxValue: 100,
    fill: 0x990000
});​

StatBarOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 200 Width of the stat bar
h number 25 Height of the stat bar
name string "HP" Name of the stat
value number 0 Current value of the stat
fill number 0x990000 Color to fill the stat bar
maxValue number 100 Maximum value of the stat
padding number 5 Padding around the stat bar

Eating Animals

This component allows the player to choose between different animals to eat.

Syntax

game.render.component('eating_animals', EatingAnimalsOptions);​

Example

game.render.component('eating_animals', {
    w: 450,
    h: 150
});​

EatingAnimalsOptions Reference:

Property Data type Default value Description
w number 450 Width of the component
h number 150 Height of the component

Factions

Factions are a mainstay in the game and all NPC's even the player characters belong to a faction.

All factions in the game

_BLUEPRINTS.FACTIONS
Note: Modifying the FACTIONS blueprints before the game is loaded is safe and would just change that faction in game. Once in game, modifying this data would have unwanted side effects.

Get faction
const sinFaction = game.session.factions.getFaction("sincorp");

Get player reputation

game.session.factions.getReputation('faction_sincorp');

Add player reputation

game.session.factions.removeReputation('faction_sincorp', 5)

Add reputation between factions

game.session.factions.addReputationFor('faction_sincorp', 'faction_yamakai', 50)

Check if two factions are hostile to eachother

game.session.factions.factionHostile('faction_sincorp', 'faction_nomad')
